creator.name: Protestantse Gemeente van Aruba
creator.his_func: For Protestants in Aruba in 1816 there was no church organization and no spiritual care. The reformed elders and deacons of Curaçao requested the 'Committee on behalf of the affairs of the Protestant Churches in the Netherlands East and West Indies' in The Hague to appoint K. van Eekhout religious teacher for Aruba. This was done by Royal Decree (KB) in 1822. The first service on 25 August 1822 is considered the formal beginning of the Protestant congregation of Aruba. Aruba had its own reverend only from 3 October 1858.
